  • Constructor Details

    • CheckoutScreenController

      public CheckoutScreenController(javafx.scene.layout.HBox wholeScreen, Object prevController)
      Initializes a new `CheckoutScreenController` with the given screen and previous controller.
      Parameters:
      wholeScreen - the main screen container for the checkout view
      prevController - the previous screen controller, expected to be of type `RestaurantMenuScreenController`

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      Initializes the checkout screen by setting up the date label, configuring radio buttons, and adding listeners for live validation. It sets the initial states for the various UI elements based on the customer's type and the supplier's details.

    • setupInitialUI

      private void setupInitialUI()
      Sets up the initial UI state by configuring default values and states for UI components. This includes setting default text, hiding labels, updating wallet and price labels, populating DROPDOWN with cities, initializing the date picker, and configuring radio buttons.

    • updateWalletAndPriceLabels

      private void updateWalletAndPriceLabels()
      Updates the wallet balance and item price labels in the UI. Retrieves the customer's wallet balance and formats it for display, and updates the item price label with the current item price.

    • populateCityDropdown

      private void populateCityDropdown()
      Populates the city DROPDOWN with relevant delivery cities.

    • setupRadioButtons

      private void setupRadioButtons()
      Sets up the radio buttons and their associated ToggleGroup.

    • setupWalletField

      private void setupWalletField()
      Sets up the wallet field and its listeners.

    • setupListeners

      private void setupListeners()
      Sets up the listeners for various UI components.

    • setupWalletRadioButtonListener

      private void setupWalletRadioButtonListener()
      Sets up listener for the wallet radio button.

    • setupSharedRadioButtonListener

      private void setupSharedRadioButtonListener()
      Sets up listener for the shared radio button.

    • setupBasicRadioButtonListener

      private void setupBasicRadioButtonListener()
      Sets up listener for the basic radio button.

    • setupTakeAwayRadioButtonListener

      private void setupTakeAwayRadioButtonListener()
      Sets up listener for the takeaway radio button.

    • setupAmountFieldListener

      private void setupAmountFieldListener()
      Sets up listener for the amount field.

    • setupWalletFieldListener

      private void setupWalletFieldListener()
      Sets up listener for the wallet field.

    • setupDatePickerListener

      private void setupDatePickerListener()
      Sets up listener for the date picker.

    • setupSupplyTimeFieldListener

      private void setupSupplyTimeFieldListener()
      Sets up listener for the supply time field.

    • ContinueToSummary

      private void ContinueToSummary() throws IOException
      Handles the action to proceed to the summary page. This method performs all necessary validations for the fields and ensures that all data is correctly entered before moving on. It checks each field and shows relevant error messages if any validation fails. calls the server to update order and items_in_orders tables with relevant info in the end open the summary screen
      Throws:
      IOException

    • pressBack

      private void pressBack() throws IOException
      Handles the "Back" button action. Loads the previous screen (Restaurant Menu Screen) and clears the current dashboard content.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while loading the previous screen.

    • checkAllFields

      private boolean checkAllFields()
      Checks the validity of all fields on the checkout screen and displays appropriate alerts if any field is invalid. It aggregates the validity of all fields and provides feedback to the user on which fields need correction.
      Returns:
      true if any field is invalid, false otherwise.

    • showAlert

      private void showAlert(String title, String message)
      Shows an alert with the specified title and message to provide feedback to the user regarding errors or important information.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the alert.
      message - the content of the alert message.

    • configureAvailableRadioButtons

      private void configureAvailableRadioButtons()
      Configures the availability and state of radio buttons based on the customer's type. Enables or disables radio buttons and updates the state of associated fields as appropriate.

    • addValidationListeners

      private void addValidationListeners()
      Adds validation listeners to the fields on the checkout screen. These listeners provide live feedback on the validity of the fields as the user interacts with them.

    • validateReciverName

      private void validateReciverName()
      Validates the receiver's name field. Checks if the name contains only letters and sets the field border color to red if invalid, or green if valid.

    • validateReciverPhone

      private void validateReciverPhone()
      Validates the receiver's phone field. Checks if the phone number starts with '05' and contains exactly 10 digits. Sets the field border color to red if invalid, or green if valid.

    • validateSupplyTime

      private void validateSupplyTime()
      Validates the supply time field. Ensures the time is within the acceptable range based on the selected date. If the date is today, the time must be between now and the end of the day. Sets the field border color to red if invalid, or green if valid.

    • validateAddressField

      private void validateAddressField()
      Validates the address field. Checks if the address field is not empty and sets the field border color to red if empty, or green if valid.

    • validateAmountField

      private void validateAmountField()
      Validates the amount field for shared delivery. Ensures that the amount is a positive integer and does not start with '0'. Sets the field border color to red if invalid, or green if valid.

    • validateWalletField

      private void validateWalletField()
      Validates the wallet field. Ensures that the amount entered is within the customer's wallet balance and does not exceed the total price. Sets the field border color to red if invalid, or green if valid.

    • updatePriceLabels

      private void updatePriceLabels()
      Updates the price labels for delivery and total price. This method calculates the delivery price based on the selected radio button: - If basicRadioBtn is selected, the delivery price is set to 25. - If SharedRadioBtn is selected, the delivery price depends on the quantity entered in amountField: - 1 : 25 - 2 user: 40 (20 each) - 3 or more: 15 per user - If takeAwayRadioBtn or RobotRadioBtn is selected, the delivery price is 0. The method also reads the wallet amount from WalletField and updates the labels deliveryPriceLbl and totalPriceLbl with the calculated delivery and total prices.

    • initializeDatePicker

      private void initializeDatePicker()
      Initializes the date picker to show today's date and restricts the selectable range to one week. This method sets the date picker to default to today's date and restricts selectable dates to between today and one week from today. It also formats the displayed date as "yyyy-MM-dd". The date picker disables dates before today and after one week from today. It includes a custom string converter to format the date display.

    • getSelectedDeliveryType

      private SupplyMethod getSelectedDeliveryType()
      Returns the selected delivery type based on the currently selected radio button.
      Returns:
      The selected SupplyMethod which can be BASIC, SHARED, ROBOT, or TAKEAWAY.

    • getOrderType

      private OrderType getOrderType()
      Determines the order type based on the current order type string.
      Returns:
      The OrderType which can be PRE_ORDER or REGULAR.

    • checkSupplyTime

      private void checkSupplyTime(LocalDate selectedDate, String supplyTime)
      Checks if the supply time is more than 2 hours from the current time and updates the order type accordingly.
      Parameters:
      selectedDate - The date selected for the supply.
      supplyTime - The time of the supply in the format HH:mm:ss.

    • isValidTimeFormat

      private boolean isValidTimeFormat(String timeText)
      Validates if the given time string is in the correct format of HH:mm:ss.
      Parameters:
      timeText - The time string to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if the time string is in the correct format, false otherwise.

    • OrderSummaryScreen

      private void OrderSummaryScreen() throws IOException
      Loads and displays the order summary screen. using `ScreenLoader` to load the `OrderSummaryScreen.fxml` file, clears the current dashboard, and adds the new order summary screen to the dashboard.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while loading the FXML file
